title: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Herbal and somewhat weedy, this is a thin wine from a coolish year, offering faint amounts of cassis, cranberry and milk chocolate.

title: Gracianna 2013 Mercedes Riverblock Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From an estate vineyard, this wine is somewhat unformed and quite feral, largely tannic, with a rough-hewn texture. The oak is overwhelming and needs time to settle, to better reveal the abundance of strawberry and cherry fruit.

title: Illinois Sparkling Co. NV Heirloom Sparkling Rosé Sparkling (Illinois)
description: Medium-salmon in color, this sparkling rosé made from Marechal Foch offers raspberry and strawberry flavors and aromas, with a slightly toasted character. Creamy, nutty notes take over on the finish.

title: Imperial 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Curicó Valley)
description: Berry aromas take on a savory and animal hide note. The dense palate carries herbal and earthy flavors, with mulchy, stalky berry tones that come with a dash of coffee grinds. An earthy finish is suggestive of fresh compost.

title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2015 Los Vascos Chardonnay (Colchagua Valley)
description: Crisp aromas of citrus are feline and snappy. This smells more like Sauvignon Blanc than Chardonnay, and the palate is racy and citric as well. Lime, nettle and tangerine flavors finish green, tart and long, with acidic push.

title: Odyssey NV Forbidden Fruit Red (Arizona)
description: This eclectic blend of Grenache, Alicante Bouschet and Marselan mixes high-toned blackberry compote with bramble-patch. The juicy red fruit is supported by just enough sharp acidity and tannins to maintain balance.

title: Oliver 2012 Dry Red (America)
description: A blend of Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine shows tones of red currant juice and geranium. Light in body and tannin, this is mild and approachable.

title: Montes 2012 La Finca Clos D'Angel Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley)
description: This Cabernet is topped with a coating of char and oak. Creamy and resiny in feel, this is a sticky, confected wine, with flavors of vanilla, resiny spice and berry fruits backed by lactic oak on the finish.

title: Montes 2013 Malbec (Colchagua Valley)
description: A thick slathering of oak gives this Malbec a plastic-like coating on the nose; in addition, there are aromas of brushy, herbal berry fruits. This is chunky and plump in feel, with herbal, oaky, minty flavors that outweigh the wine's berry character. The finish is hot and oaky.

title: Morandé 2013 Reserva Malbec (Maule Valley)
description: Gritty, seemingly reduced aromas of berry and plum are herbal and come with an olive note. This is highly acidic, with a scouring mouthfeel and finish. Tart flavors of berry fruits lead to a finish with some bitterness.

title: Haak 2013 Estate Reserve Blanc du Bois (Texas)
description: Lemon spray and savory cheese-rind notes mark the nose and palate. Having seen some time in oak, this boasts a round body and mild acidity.

title: James Charles 2014 Fumé Blanc (Virginia)
description: Banana, powdered white candies and creamy coconut make an appearance on the nose of this Sauvignon Blanc that sees time in neutral oak. Dull tropical-fruit flavors mark the palate, with watery papaya in the lead. Mild acidity works hard to enliven the slightly lazy finish.

title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014 Léon  (Coteaux Bourguignons)
description: This wine has a bitter edge to it, although attractive fruit lies underneath. It is juicy, packed with red fruits and acidity, although that surface bitterness is off-putting.

title: Slow Press 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Fairly shy aromas of crushed grapes and grape seeds show on the nose of this widely available wine. It's also quite reserved on the palate, offering just a touch of plum, grape and earth elements.

title: Honig 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This white is quite tropical, with a hot, spicy note of jalapeño. Light in terms of texture and body, it finishes with a suggestion of orange peel and mango.

title: Intipalka 2012 Valle del Sol Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Ica)
description: Stalky, earthy aromas of roasted, raw berry fruits suggest underripeness. This feels solid on the exterior but weak in the middle. Creamy, oaky plum flavors have a bitter, roasted quality, while on the finish it's heavy, creamy oak in charge.

title: Intipalka 2014 Valle del Sol Malbec (Ica)
description: Forest-floor aromas of mushroom and herbal berry and plum open this Peruvian Malbec that's tight and drawing on the palate. Baked plum, chocolate and pounding oak flavors finish heavy, with notes of prune and carob.

title: Intipalka 2014 Valle del Sol Sauvignon Blanc (Ica)
description: Radiator dust and Animal Cracker aromas are not typical of Sauvignon Blanc. On the palate, this opens with mild citric notes but quickly shifts to flatness. Pithy orange and apricot flavors finish yeasty, with a distant hint of citrus zest.

title: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2011 Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Sweet tannins and an extracted, concentrated sense of brambly blackberry make for a robust wine, puckering in weight and oak. Rustic, leathery overtones dominate the bouquet and finish.

title: The Winery SF 2013 Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: This medium-bodied Chardonnay smells sweet like marshmallows but tastes dry. It shows mild peach and lean apple flavors, a slight earthy touch and crisp-enough balance.

title: Vistamar 2014 Reserva Sepia Riesling (Casablanca Valley)
description: This Riesling is an odd one. Aromas of yeast and peach blossom come with a note of cured ham, while the palate is sticky and low in acidity. Creamy, honeyed flavors alongside green melon, vanilla and yeast finish waxy and creamy.

title: Kenos 2013 Reserve Syrah (Curicó Valley)
description: Raspberry aromas come with olive-like accents. This feels wiry and pinched, while the combination of snappy, sharp acidity and heavy oak clash, creating short red-plum flavors. On the finish, this flattens out and lacks length.

title: Duchman Family 2012 Oswald Vineyard Aglianico (Texas)
description: Spiced red berries meet earthy floral tones on the nose. Round in feel, the palate carries red currant and strawberry tones, flecked by warm spice flavors. Burnt brown sugar signals the close.

title: Duchman Family 2014 Bingham Family Vineyard Vermentino (Texas)
description: Peach, yellow plum and underripe banana tones mark the nose. Banana makes an appearance again—in candied form—on the medium-bodied, almost oily palate. Sharp lemon citrus tones race on the finish.

title: Frostwatch 2013 Vice Versa Semillon (Bennett Valley)
description: Combining 80% Sémillon with 20% Sauvignon Blanc, this is an intense, oaky and almost caramelized wine. Off dry, with the producer reporting less than 1% residual sugar, it retains a sweetness of baked melon and peach, finishing ripe and round.

title: Concha y Toro 2014 Casillero del Diablo Reserva Pinot Grigio (Chile)
description: Dusty, waxy peach aromas lead to a round, oily palate, with just enough acidic verve to keep the wine's pulse up. Mealy apple, petrol and an oxidized note send this towards a waxy-feeling finish.

title: Carlson Creek 2012 Rule of Three Red (Cochise County)
description: This GSM from the southeastern corner of Arizona is medium bodied, with mild, easy tannins. A rubbery berry aroma on the nose turns more candied and fruity on the palate.

title: Domaine de Fabrègues 2014 Le Mas White (Languedoc)
description: A blend of 70% Grenache Blanc and 30% Vermentino, this shows herbal aromas of mache, lemon thyme and verbena alongside fruity tones of green apple and citrus pith. The palate is light and flat, needing more vibrancy and intensity to match the nose.

title: Draxton 2014 Nelson Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: There's a patch of grass at the heart of this wine, followed by dry, nearly puckering layers of lemon and lime that reach an apex of dryness on the finish, accented in jalapeño.

title: Echeverria NV Espumante Brut Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Central Valley)
description: Flat, disparate aromas of bread and white fruits are mild. On the palate, this is plump but lacks edge and structure. Briny flavors of tropical fruits finish foamy and with a pickled flavor.
